6.author: EvLokadottr
6.body:
I think some fruit flies got to them, though. :( I've been bedbound, and my best friend has been watering them and just leaving any rotting fruit in the soil, arghl. Injustice found out, aaaand, that explains the fruit flies I've been seeing. 

Still, they're so cute! 

Think they would be safe to eat if washed? Be peppers grown in a garden taste so much better than store-bought ones, which are huge, but so flavorless for some reason.

6.body: Bet the weed buds are big and juicy in that "basement garden'

6.author: EvLokadottr
6.body:
Haha, I think I am the only person in upstate NY who bought a grow light last summer to grow things that WEREN'T pot. 

I mean, I totally would, but I'm deathly allergic to weed. It suuuuuuucks. I have PTSD and severe chronic pain and would love to make cannabutter brownies or something, but no. My ass has to carry around an EpiPen because they recently legalized smoking it anywhere you can smoke a cigarette. I'm ALSO allergic to tobacco. It isn't quite as bad, but I have had to be intubated for that before, too. 

FML.

6.author: flannelmaster9
6.body: Are you allergic to hops and/or beer as well? I had a buddy in highschool who was moderately allergic to weed and hops

6.author: EvLokadottr
6.body:
Not sure, honestly, as I hate beer, lol. I do have a mild nightshade allergy, however. Apparently one of the allergy pathways involves pot, tobacco, and nightshades. 

Also Timothy hay'

8.body:
Oh look, Professor "you didn't read your homework" Wankerson is pretending someone else is a troll.

8.author: LeDimpsch
8.body:
You didn't admit anything. You made a smug remark implying one thing and then another that implied the opposite. That's not admitting you're wrong, that's being full of it twice in a row.

Three times, if you're counting your weird "I glossed over things" "I don't gloss over things" series.

8.author: CassandraVindicated
8.body: Did I say "My bad?" It was a thing I meant to follow up on and when you mentioned it I realized I hadn't taken that into account. You must be fun at parties.

8.author: LeDimpsch
8.body:
Let's be clear: You said "my bad" just before dropping your bullshit contradiction.

Saying "Sorry about that, here's some bullshit" isn't an admission of much of anything.

Try to focus here. You've delivered a series of smug nothings while pretending to be baffled by the negative reaction.

You must be pretty shit at parties yourself. Twisting yourself into knots, making shit up as you go, pretending someone else is weird for noticing.

8.author: CassandraVindicated
8.body: OK, you have yourself a nice life, but I'm done here.

8.author: LeDimpsch
8.body: Great! You have yourself a nice life, too. Maybe don't be as smug in the moments before you contradict yourself next time. And maybe dial down the disingenuous bullshit follow-up.

10.author: Nervous_Promotion819
10.body: You say people with a migration background are not Germans? Pretty racist I have to say. So the hamburger is also a German invention because some German immigrants invented it in the US?

10.author: spaceship247
10.body:
Lmao gtfo with ur racism Bs

And yeah dummy, that’s why it’s called a hamburger, u know, Hamburg ? 

Anyway have a nice day

10.author: Nervous_Promotion819
10.body: The thing is, Hamburg is just the namesake. Only the patty was invented in Germany, the burger first in the US. Kebab was invented in Turkey, the German Döner with it’s bread and filling in Germany. I said racist, because you said the difference is that the inventors of tea with milk were British, implying those from German Döner weren't, but the inventors were Germans with Turkish migration background

10.author: spaceship247
10.body:
The namesake? That’s where it comes from lol. You think they just plucked the name out of thin air?

Well probably you need to understand what racism means or stop watching so many YouTube videos

10.author: Nervous_Promotion819
10.body: I’m German and no one here believes or thinks that Hamburgers in today’s form are a German invention. Hamburgers were thinly pressed meatballs that German emigrants brought to the United States. There they put it in a sandwich for the first time and gave this creation the same name. I have no idea why but that's the way it is. Just like Dutch people are Dutch today because Americans thought they were German (in German: Deutsch). Sorry that the entire integration and migration debate in Germany is very big and that many people who have lived here for several generations are not German for some people because their ancestors come from another country. As I said, that's why I said racist

21.author: Privacy_Jimmy
21.body:
I'm not seeing any evidence of coal exploding on either of your videos.

Or are you simply suggesting that because you have evidence of burning coal you are an authority on what coal looks like and how it behaves?

I've been around plenty of coal fires and I've never experienced coal exploding and wedging into a fireguard in a fibrous form.

I think what's more likely is that OP mistook wood for coal.

I thought you were OP when I read your first reply.

21.author: Wienerwrld
21.body: I was showing you that where *I* live, and where people speak English, the glowing chunks of wood remaining at the end of a fire are called “coals.” It’s a common term. I’m sorry it confuses you.

21.author: Privacy_Jimmy
21.body:
>I was showing you that where *I* live, and where people speak English, the glowing chunks of wood remaining at the end of a fire are called “coals.” It’s a common term. I’m sorry it confuses you.

It's not confusing. LOL. You just didn't make it clear that that is what you were trying to tell me.

I didn't notice you saying that at any point in your video. (Note that even if you said "coals" it wouldn't be clear what you meant unless you explained it.)

Not sure why you didn't just say what is quoted above in the first place, but thanks for the explanation anyway. 👍

24.author: burntbread369
24.body: Exactly. It’s the internet, we’re all in different countries. No one has any idea if OP is in a country where you can or cannot get pop tarts from places other than the grocery store. That’s why them saying “the grocery store?? where else would I get it???” is taken as being rude. From the perspective of everyone else here, there are many other places OP could have gotten it. We can’t assume they’re in a country where you can get pop tarts at cafeterias and we can’t assume they’re in a country where you can’t get pop tarts at cafeterias. But by putting the ??s after their answer, they make it seem like the suggestion that they live somewhere where pop tarts are sold in cafeterias is ridiculous. It’s only ridiculous if you know what country OP is in. We don’t. So for us it’s not a ridiculous suggestion and it seems mean to respond like it is.

24.author: KieDaPie
24.body: That's a lotta bold assumptions... Especially tonally. But even then, op got downvoted on all their comments, even the ones clarifying the misunderstanding lmao. Why's that?

24.author: burntbread369
24.body: What bold assumptions did I make? Especially other than tonally?

24.author: KieDaPie
24.body:
>No one has any idea if OP is in a country where you can or cannot get pop tarts from places other than the grocery store.

you're assuming people are downvoting them because they don't know that OP can only buy poptarts from groceries... and because of the question marks (?) they sounded rude...  but that's obviously not it since they're also being downvoted on the comments clarifying things, and they really don't sound like a rude person at all. it looks like people are just salty against op for some reason, and I genuinely do not know why. you ignored my question asking that so idk what to say ...

as far as I see OP has just been defending themselves against oddly-angry commenters who seem upset that OP ever considered looking at the instructions on a poptart lmaoooo (even though I think they meant to draw attention to the seemingly-pointless white sticker covering the label). i actually find it really funny that reddit just decides to hate on the most mundane and harmless things

24.author: burntbread369
24.body:
I answered your question. You are choosing not to believe my answer. People are salty because they interpreted the question marks in the initial comment to be dismissive. The second comment made it seem as though OP considered it obvious that pop tarts could not be purchased at vending machines where they are, people took offense to the implication that they should already know where OP. After that everything else OP was read in the same tone that people interpreted the first comments to be. 

That is why people are downvoting OP. I explained that already. I don’t understand what about this you don’t understand.

24.author: KieDaPie
24.body:
>The second comment made it seem as though OP considered it obvious that pop tarts could not be purchased at vending machines where they are, people took offense to the implication that they should already know where OP.

Bruh. People who got offended cuz of that probably won the Olympics in mental gymnastics. Plus, I think only Americans would get offended at that since I don't think any other country really sells pop tarts outside of grocery stores. Which makes sense because this post about an American snack probably draws more Americans than non-americans.

24.author: burntbread369
24.body: is it mental gymnastics or are you just incredibly inflexible

24.author: KieDaPie
24.body: Mental gymnastics for sure. I also stretch everyday.

24.author: burntbread369
24.body: ok well everyone but you was able to come to this conclusion without considering it even a reach. so.

25.author: Alternative-Sock-444
25.body: Not getting caught doesn't make something not illegal... If I kill someone, but never get caught, I still broke the law. If you change the odometer, and never get caught, you still broke the law. You're right, it is a very easy concept to grasp and I'm not sure what's stopping you from doing so.

25.author: Alternative-Sock-444
25.body:
That's cool. But your original point was that a rental facility rolled back the odometer. 

1. Not possible

2. Rental places sell their cars after 50k miles 

So regardless of what you do, a rental facility cannot and will not roll back odometers. So your original comment was wrong no matter how you spin it.

25.author: Alternative-Sock-444
25.body: It can stand in your mind all you want, but it's still wrong. Breaking the law is breaking the law. Caught or not. Also, selling isn't the only worry depending on where you live. You may still need to get a yearly/bi-yearly inspection and/or registration. Both of which they check your mileage for. If there's a mileage discrepancy, you'll be fined and likely have the car impounded.

33.body: I work in a similar industry

33.author: Fisherbuck_
33.body: It’s shit work but paid really good.

33.author: BurstingWithFlava
33.body: My job is way too easy lol. 2 hour rolls and I literally watch glue dry

33.author: Fisherbuck_
33.body: What kind of paper do you make? We made board liner for boxes. When I worked in the lab testing paper it was great, but when we had field days once a month, they would tear the machine down and service it. Man, that machine was 400 feet long and EVERYTHING on it that you had to tear down with maintenance weighed a fucking ton and those were automatic 16 hour days. I got stuck working so many 12 and 16 hour shifts from call outs my wife fell into a depression. I had to quit.

33.author: BurstingWithFlava
33.body: Haha nah my job is a breeze. We are more an adhesive company that applies different glues to different types of materials. Some paper rolls, some plastic. It goes off and gets made into all kinds of other things like stickers and lining for airplanes. The rolls are massive and because we deal with glue we clean pretty regularly. But we can’t clean while we run otherwise glue gets dusty. Lol it’s literally so easy, I sit on Reddit 7 hours a day and have maybe 1-2 hours of actual work

33.author: Fisherbuck_
33.body: Good for you. Fuck the man! Our rolls were 120,000 pounds. Huge ass roll.

34.author: coldfries_
34.body: I took a whole photo shoot but the sub doesn't allow gallery posts 😅

34.author: coldfries_
34.body: Oh you don't staple your paper with water too?

34.author: coldfries_
34.body: Sure Felt like Jimmy Nelson after taking that photo 😅

35.author: b1e
35.body: Update: it fits. Not too snug not too loose. Wife is not as amused as I am.

35.author: rehab_VET
35.body: I kinda want one just for that… maybe like a firemen’s helmet ?

35.author: b1e
35.body: Tell you what, I retained the hat for further… research later

35.author: b1e
35.body: I’ve seen the same brand before in the winter but without the hats. I wonder if that’s why.
